questions.question: If $27^(x+2) ÷ 9^(x+1) = 3^(2x)$, find x
questions.correction:
$27^(x+2) ÷ 9^Cx+1) = 3^(2x)$

Reduce 27 and 9 to have the same base as 3

$3^3(x+2) ÷ 3^2(x+1) = 3^(2x)$

Note, - is ÷ and + is for powers of indices of the same bases.

$3^(3(x+2) - 2(x+1)) = 3^(2x)$

Equating the exponentials
3(x+2)−2(x+1)=2x3(x+2)−2(x+1)=2x
Clear brackets
3x+6−2x−2=2x3x+6−2x−2=2x
Collect like terms
3x−2x−2x=−6+23x−2x−2x=−6+2
x−2x=−4x−2x=−4
−x=−4−x=−4
Divide both sides by −−
x=4x=4
Answer is B

questions.question: A farmer uses ${2}/{5}$ of his land to grow cassava,${1}/{3}$of the remaining for yam and the rest for maize. Find the part of the land used for maize
questions.correction:
Let x represent the entire farmland

then, ${2}/{5}x + {1}/{3}[x-{2}/{3}x] + M = x$

Where M represents the part of the farmland used for growing maize, continuing

${2}/{5}x + {1}/{3}[x-{2}/{3}x] + M = x$

${2}/{5}x + {1}/{3}x[{3}/{5}] + M = x$

${2}/{5}x + {1}/{5}x + M = x$

M = x - ${3}/{5}$x

= x [1-${3}/{5}$]

Hence the part of the land used for growing maize is ${2}/{5}$

= 22.5km

questions.question: Find the value of p if ${1}/{4}p + 3q = 10$ and 2p - q = 7
questions.correction:
${1}/{4}p + 3q = 10$...(1)

$2p - {1}/{3}q = 7$

Multiply equation (2) by 3 to clear fraction

$3 × 2p - 3 × {1}/{3}q = 3 × 7$

6p - q = 21

6p -21 = q....(3)

Substituting 6p - 21 for q in (1)

$[1}/{4}p + 3(6p-21) = 10$...(4)

Multiply equation (4) by 4 to clear fraction 

$4 × {1}/{4}p + 4×3(6p-21) = 4 ×10$

p + 12(6p - 21) = 40

p + 72p - 252

73p = 292

p = ${292}/{73}

= 4

questions.question: Find the equation of a line parallel to y = -4x + 2 passing through (2,3)
questions.correction:
By comparing y = mx + c with y = -4x + 2, the gradient of y = -4x + 2 is m1 = -4
Let the gradient of the line parallel to the given line be m2,
then, m2 = m1 = -4 (condition for parallelism)
Using: y - y1 = m2(x - x1)
Hence the equation of the parallel line is
y - 3 = -4(x-2)
y - 3 = -4 x + 8
y + 4x = 8 + 3
y + 4x = 11
y + 4x - 11 = 0

questions.question: if y = ${2x+1}^3 find {dy}/{dx}$
questions.correction:
If y = ${2x+1}^3$, then let u = 2x + 1

so that y = ${u^3}$

${dy}/{du}$ = 3${u^2}$ and ${dy}/{dx}$ = 2

questions.question: Three consecutive positive integers k, l and m are such that l22 = 3(k+m). Find the value of m.

k2 + 2k + 1 = 6k + 6

k2 - 4k - 5 = 0

k2 - 5k + k - 5 = 0

= 7.
